archimate:Principle.name: DP08 - Discoverability, Availability, and Accessibility of Data
archimate:Principle.documentation:
The potential of shared data resources is maximized by three key factors: discoverability, availability, and accessibility. Data space initiatives should focus on ensuring both the availability and effective utilization of data, unlocking the full potential of data sharing among various participants.
Core concepts: Availability, Openness and Accessibility, discoverability
Best practices for ensuring the availability and usage of data involve building trust among data space partners, promoting the re-use of publicly held data, demonstrating the added value of data sharing, improving data quality through validation against other sources, and prioritizing user needs.
